mdRecord.dcterms:title: Palmer St. Clair, office manager of the Virginia Employment Commission, tells WSLS-TV about the surge of part-time employment opportunities in Roanoke, Va., area shopping stores
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Palmer St. Clair, office manager of the Virginia Employment Commission, tells WSLS-TV about increased job opportunities in retail due to the upcoming holiday season. According to St. Clair, shopping centers around Roanoke, Va., will be looking to hire housewives, high school students, and college students of both genders who are in good physical condition to work flexible part-time jobs. Footage switches from St. Clair at his desk at the Roanoke, Va., offices of the Virginia Employment Commission, to consumers shopping at retail department stores.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Virginia Employment Commission
